intro: Appendicula rupicola, commonly known as the rock appendicula, is a small flowering plant native to the alpine regions of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, often succulent growth habit. The plant produces delicate, bilaterally symmetric flowers in shades of pink and white, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
